item.description:
Presentation Description:
Learn how to get starting using ElectroServer (ES5) to build multiplayer games and virtual worlds. In this session we’ll discuss the ES5’s features, development tools, production options, as well as how to get started building your first multiplayer game. In addition we’ll also cover best practices as well as a few advanced techniques.

Presenter Bio:
As Senior Software Engineer at Digitas, Ryan delivers high-end RIA experiences to Digitas’ clients including P&G, Aflac and Goodyear. Ryan develops Flash and Flex content using AIR for Android/IOS, the desktop, and the browser.

Prior to Digitas, Ryan worked at litl (litl.com) supporting and evangelizing their ActionScript SDK. Before litl, Ryan was at Brodeur Partners where he helped shape online and digital experiences for a number of top-tier B2C and B2B brands including Toshiba, RIM, American Express, and Orbitz.

Ryan is an Adobe Community Professional, an industry thought leader, and an active participant in the tech community. Recently appointed Manager of Boston Flash Platform User Group (BFPUG), Ryan brings the Adobe developer community together for presentations and discussions on RIA development. Most recently Ryan has spoken at RIA Unleashed, FITC Unconference at Adobe MAX, and 360 Flex Washington DC, as well as a variety of user groups ranging from Las Vegas to Chicago.

Join At:

You can join in at http://experts.na3.acrobat.com/ofmg/

Check what time this occurs in your time zone at:
http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?hour=18&min=0&sec=0&p1=98

Logging In:

When you login to the Connect room (the link above)
to view the meeting, PLEASE USE THE "LOGIN AS GUEST" option, and USE YOUR NAME, but do NOT
attempt to use your meetup.com username/password or any Connect account. Just sign in as a guest.


ADD THIS TO YOUR CALENDAR:
Want to add this event to your own personal calendar? Click the link
on the top of the event page, below the event title, saying, "Export to a calendar", which offers
calendar downloads for Outlook, iCal, Google, and Yahoo calendars.
item.name: Getting started building games with ElectroServer 5 w/ Ryan Canulla
